titleStmt.title: O. D. McManama et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4123

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Govr Thos. E. Bramlett

The undersigned citizens of Circuit ^Grant^ County would respectfully represent that at the last May Term of the Grant Circuit Court one O. P. Billiter was fined fifty Dollars for carrying concealed weapons. We think it a hardship upon Mr Billiter to pay that Sum He is a young man of Sober habits, and a good citizen, we would therefore be pleased to have you remit so much of the fine as will be pleasing to your Excellency

O. D. McManama
John Marksbury
Weden Oneal
J W. Collins
W. T. Simmons ct atty
H. Kendall
R. J. Dyas P. J. G. C. C
S A Franklin C. G. C C
T. S. Porter
T. L. Clark
J. W. Williams
Isaac Biddle
Andrew Sheriff
L. Cavanagh
Theo OHara
J. F. Sheriff
E. H. Bruth
Squire Lucas
O. P. Billiter Pet for remission of fine $50 for carry concealed weapons -- (Grant Co)
No sufficent cause shown for Executive interposition
